meanings.sent1: The tall tree overshadowed the small flower.
meanings.sent2: The dark cloud overshadowed the sun, causing shade.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella overshadowed the picnic, making it cooler.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice overshadowed the quiet whispers in the room.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak overshadowed the entire landscape, blocking the view.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem less important in comparison.
meanings.sent1: Her bright personality overshadowed his dull presence.
meanings.sent2: The new invention overshadowed the old one, making it obsolete.
meanings.sent3: The colorful painting overshadowed the plain one, stealing the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: His impressive skills overshadowed the rest of the team, making him stand out.
meanings.sent5: The grand fireworks display overshadowed the small bonfire, captivating the audience.
